### Advanced Contract Award Notice (ACAN)

#### Title:
Elder Services

#### Reference Number:
PW-23-01028246

#### Solicitation Number:
21206-24-4308711

#### Publication Date:
2023-03-01

#### Tender Closing Date:
2023-03-16T13:00:00

### Notice Summary

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) intends to award a contract for Elder Services to a pre-identified supplier. The services to be provided include spiritual and cultural support to Indigenous offenders in correctional facilities.

### Notice Description

The CSC is seeking a supplier who can provide Elder services, including:

* Counseling and guidance to offenders
* Spiritual services and traditional ceremonies
* Advice and guidance to staff and management on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices
* Case management to support offender reintegration

The supplier must meet the minimum essential requirements, including:

* Being recognized as an Elder or Cultural Advisor in their community
* Having a minimum of five years of experience in delivering spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous people
* Familiarity with traditional medicines and spiritual effects
* Ability to conduct ceremonies and provide guidance to staff and offenders

### Procurement Details

* This procurement is set aside for an Indigenous supplier under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business.
* The contract is for a period of one year, with an option to extend for two additional one-year periods.
* The estimated value of the contract is $133,220.85 (GST/HST extra).

### How to Respond

Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the services described in the ACAN may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person identified in this notice by the closing date and time of March 16, 2023 at 2:00 PM ADT.

Please direct inquiries and statement of capabilities to:
Claudia Landry, Regional Contract Officer
1045 Main Street, 2nd Floor
Moncton, NB E1C 1H1
Telephone: 506-378-8722
Facsimile: 506-851-6327
E-mail: Claudia.landry@csc-scc.gc.ca
